## 🌍 Top 5 Global Fintech News

- **[Fintech founder charged with fraud; AI app found to be humans in the Philippines](https://techcrunch.com/2025/04/10/fintech-founder-charged-with-fraud-after-ai-shopping-app-found-to-be-powered-by-humans-in-the-philippines/)** — *Hacker News* — A fintech founder faces fraud charges after their supposedly AI-powered shopping app was discovered to be operated by human workers in the Philippines.

- **[Americans see their savings vanish in Synapse fintech crisis](https://www.cnbc.com/2024/11/22/synapse-bankruptcy-thousands-of-americans-see-their-savings-vanish.html)** — *Hacker News* — Thousands of Americans lost access to their savings following the bankruptcy of fintech middleware firm Synapse, raising serious questions about consumer protections in embedded banking.

- **[Fintech is making credit cards weirder](https://workweek.com/2022/08/05/fintech-is-making-credit-cards-weirder/)** — *Hacker News* — Fintech innovation is pushing credit card products in new directions, with novel rewards structures and niche offerings reshaping how consumers think about credit.

- **[Apple acquires UK open banking startup Credit Kudos](https://ffnews.com/newsarticle/apple-acquires-uk-open-banking-startup-credit-kudos/)** — *Hacker News* — Apple has acquired UK-based open banking startup Credit Kudos, signalling the tech giant's deepening interest in financial data and credit assessment.

- **[Open Banking and Payments Competition](https://www.bitsaboutmoney.com/archive/open-banking-and-payments-competition/)** — *Hacker News* — A detailed analysis explores how open banking frameworks are reshaping competition in the payments landscape and what that means for consumers and incumbents alike.

## 🍁 Top 5 Canadian Fintech News

- **[H&R Block Canada taps Affirm to make tax season less taxing](https://financialpost.com/pmn/business-wire-news-releases-pmn/hr-block-canada-taps-affirm-to-make-tax-season-less-taxing)** — *Financial Post* — Affirm and H&R Block Canada have partnered to offer Canadians flexible buy-now-pay-later payment options for tax preparation services, bringing embedded finance to a traditionally stressful season.

- **[Canada Court Rebukes Securities Watchdog Over Forex Trading Case](https://financialpost.com/pmn/business-pmn/canada-court-rebukes-securities-watchdog-over-forex-trading-case)** — *Financial Post* — A Canadian court awarded record legal costs to simulated trading firm MyForexFunds and criticized the conduct of the Canadian securities regulator after assets were frozen for over two years.

- **[Private equity firm Novacap closes seventh and largest tech fund](https://betakit.com/private-equity-firm-novacap-closes-seventh-and-largest-tech-fund/)** — *BetaKit* — Canadian private equity firm Novacap has closed its seventh and largest-ever technology fund, signalling continued investor appetite for Canadian tech and fintech growth companies.

- **[As vacancies rise, Padder aims to insure rent payments for tenants who may not fit the traditional mould](https://betakit.com/as-vacancies-rise-padder-aims-to-insure-rent-payments-for-tenants-who-may-not-fit-the-traditional-mould/)** — *BetaKit* — Canadian startup Padder is offering rent payment insurance for non-traditional tenants, addressing a financial inclusion gap in a challenging housing market.

- **[Canada calls screen scraping 'unsecure,' sets Open Banking target for 2023](https://finledger.com/2021/08/09/canada-sets-open-banking-target-for-2023/)** — *Hacker News* — *(Still relevant context)* Canada's early push to replace screen scraping with secure open banking APIs laid the regulatory groundwork that continues to shape the country's financial data-sharing framework today.

## 🌊 Bonus: Relevant to Atlantic Fintech's Focus (1–3 articles)

- **[NordSpace launches venture arm with strategic investment in Wyvern](https://betakit.com/nordspace-launches-venture-arm-with-strategic-investment-in-wyvern/)** — *BetaKit* — Nova Scotia-based NordSpace has launched a venture investment arm with a strategic stake in satellite imagery company Wyvern, highlighting the growing appetite for Atlantic Canadian deep-tech venture activity.

- **[Can Canada find digital sovereignty in the Fediverse?](https://betakit.com/can-canada-find-digital-sovereignty-in-the-fediverse/)** — *BetaKit* — This piece explores whether decentralized digital infrastructure could offer Canada greater data sovereignty, a theme with direct implications for open banking and financial data governance in Atlantic Canada.

- **[Fintech dystopia](https://fintechdystopia.com/)** — *Hacker News* — A provocative resource cataloguing the darker side of fintech innovation, offering a useful lens for Atlantic Fintech ecosystem builders thinking critically about responsible and inclusive product design.
